metadata.title: USN-7188-1 -- FFmpeg vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that FFmpeg incorrectly handled certain input, which could lead to an integer overflow. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service by crashing the application.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-7188-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  ffmpeg - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7 ffmpeg-doc - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7 libavcodec-dev - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7 libavcodec-extra - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7 libavcodec-extra57 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7 libavcodec57 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7 libavdevice-dev - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7 libavdevice57 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7 libavfilter-dev - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7 libavfilter-extra - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7 libavfilter-extra6 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7 libavfilter6 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7 libavformat-dev - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7 libavformat57 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7 libavresample-dev - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7 libavresample3 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7 libavutil-dev - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7 libavutil55 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7 libpostproc-dev - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7 libpostproc54 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7 libswresample-dev - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7 libswresample2 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7 libswscale-dev - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7 libswscale4 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7 Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
